text:
Our collaborator from University of Hambrug is looking for a strong PhD student to work in our (me and E. Burnaev <@U0Y7U6YER>) grant on anomaly detection for semi-structured data and graph neural networks.

*Relevant publications:*
1. I. Fursov et al. Sequence embeddings help to identify fraudulent cases in healthcare insurance. 2019. <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1910.03072.pdf>
2. S. Ivanov, and Liudmila Prokhorenkova. Boost then Convolve: Gradient Boosting Meets Graph Neural Networks. 2021. _arXiv preprint arXiv:2101.08543_. *ICLR 2021.*
*Research Associate / PhD Position for the Project “Graphic Neuronal Nets for Economic Applications”*

*Institution:* Institute of Statistics, Faculty of Business Administration
*Supervisor:*  Prof. Dr. Martin Spindler, <https://scholar.google.de/citations?user=WGnn1TkAAAAJ&hl=en>,
*Salary level:* 75% of E 13 (E13 is €3,438.27-€4,962.10) for 30 weekly hours
*Start date:* 01.09.2021 or later
*End of employment period:* 31.08.2024
*Application deadline:* 15.06.2021

*Responsibilities*
Duties include academic services in the project named above. Research associates may also pursue independent research and further academic qualifications.

*Specific Duties*
Specific duties include collaboration for a DFG financed, an international research project about graphic neural nets. The project will be operated together with the Skolkovo Institute of Technology (Russia). The duties contain data processing, development, and implementation of neural nets for graphs and detection of anomalies, and the preparation of documentation. We expect publications in leading international journals and at international conferences. Furthermore, the possibility for research stays abroad and collecting teaching experience is given.

*Requirements*
A university degree in a relevant field. We are especially looking for graduates with a degree in quantitative fields of studies (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics with quantitative focus and comparable fields of studies) with an outstanding final degree. Outstanding knowledge in statistical programming (Python and R) will be expected. Experience, knowledge, or interest in the area of neural nets, deep learning, machine learning, and data analysis will be requested.

As a University of Excellence, Universität Hamburg is one of the strongest research universities in Germany. As a flagship university in the greater Hamburg region, it nurtures innovative, cooperative contacts to partners within and outside academia. It also provides and promotes sustainable education, knowledge, and knowledge exchange locally, nationally, and internationally.

Qualified disabled candidates or applicants with equivalent status receive preference in the application process.

*Contact*
Prof. Dr. Martin Spindler
Tel.: 040 42838 1544
Email: <mailto:martin.spindler@uni-hamburg.de|martin.spindler@uni-hamburg.de>

*Location*
Moorweidenstraße 18, 20148 Hamburg, Germany

Applications should include a cover letter, a tabular curriculum vitae, and copies of degree certificate(s). Please send applications by email to:

University of Hamburg, Prof. Dr. Martin Spindler, Institute of Statistics, Faculty of Business Administration, Moorweidenstraße 18, 20148 Hamburg

You can contact me, if you have any questions.
